note: Hence the two actions on the image L1,, are compatible again. Finally, Lemma 8.6.17 insures that the ExtD(L,L)-action on Ly,x can be identified with that on Lj.
title: Proposition 8.6.21. For any 0 _ (0, x) as above, the convolution action of H.(Z) on L.,x := Im(H.(M.)x -+ H.(S)x) gets identified, by means of the isomorphisms H.(Z) = ExtD(L,L) of Theorem 8.6.7 and LO Lx,x of Proposition 8.5.16, with the Ext (L, L)-action on L.,x defined above. Proof. We already know that the actions of the algebras H.(Z) and ExtD(L,L) on both H.(Mx) and H.(S) are compatible under the isomorphism of Theorem 8.6.7
Theorem 8.6.22. Every H.(Z)-module Lx,x := Im[H.(M,,)x --, H.(S)x] is simple, if non-zero. Furthermore, any simple H.(Z)-module is isomorphic to L.,,x for some pair
